caption.p: Tick-borne encephalitis: histological examination reveals perivascular lymphocytic infiltrates ( a, b) and the presence of gliomesenchymal nodules ( c, d) which may contain multinucleated giant cells ( e, f). The perivascular infiltrates are mainly made up of CD3-positive T-lymphocytes ( g) which are also homing in the surrounding brain tissue ( h). Reactive astrogliosis (stain: GFAP) ( i, j) and reactive microgliosis (stain: HLA-DRII) ( k, l) might be moderate
